page.title: 03RELIGION SECRET ROOM-BROCK
page.content: BEFORE,DURING AND AFTER THE REFORMATION THE POPULATION ROUND HERE WAS MOSTLY CATHOLIC.IN 1590 THE SECRETARY OF STATE,LORD BURGHLEY,HAD A MAP OF LANCASHIRE DRAWN,LISTING 30 LOCAL GENTRY WHO NEEDED CAREFUL WATCHING.THIS 'VIEW' HAD A CROSS BY THE NAME OF THE BROCKHOLES OF CLAUGHTON.NEXT YEAR THEY MOVED THEIR PRIVATE CHAPEL FROM THEIR HALL TO A SMALLER HOUSE NEAR BY CALLED DUCKWORTH HALL.IN AN UPSTAIRS ROOM,OPENING FROM THE SIDE OF A CUPBOARD,IS A PRIEST'S HOLE - A LONG NARROW SPACE BETWEEN TWO CHIMNEY STACKS.IT CONTAINS A WOODEN SEAT AND TWO SHELVES AND, AT THE TIME THAT IT WAS BUILT, WAS WINDOWLESS AND WOULD HAVE BEEN DIFFICULT TO DETECT.IT SHOWS THE PRECAUTIONS THOUGHT NECESSARY AT THAT TIME TO PROTECT A PRIEST IN A SMALL HOUSE IN A REMOTE COUNTRY AREA.
